english_translation: Narrated by Uthman ibn Abi al-As: I delegated to the Prophet ﷺ with people from Thaqif. They said to me: Guard our belongings and mounts. I said: On the condition that when you finish, you wait for me until I enter upon the Prophet ﷺ. They entered upon the Prophet ﷺ and asked him for their needs, then they went out. I entered upon the Prophet ﷺ and asked him for a codex (Quran) that was with him and he gave it to me. Abu Bakr ibn Abi Asim said: This is evidence that the Quran was compiled into codices during the time of the Prophet ﷺ, and this is supported by what Ibn Umar narrated from the Prophet ﷺ: Do not travel with the codices to enemy lands, which indicates it was compiled into codices.

english_translation: Two narrations from Uthman ibn Abi al-As about the Devil disturbing him during prayer: When the Prophet ﷺ sent me to Taif, something confused me in my prayer until I did not know what I was praying. When I saw that, I came to the Prophet ﷺ, and he approached me as I was walking beside him. He said: O son of Abi al-As, I said yes. He said: What brought you? I said: Something confused me in my prayer until I did not know what I was praying. He said: That is the Devil. Come closer. I came closer and sat on the balls of my feet before him. He said: Open your mouth. He struck my chest with his hand and said: Go about your work. Uthman said: I do not think the Devil disturbed me after that. The second narration adds: The Prophet ﷺ spat in my mouth and struck my chest and said: Leave, enemy of Allah, from his chest. And I did not feel it after that.

english_translation: A man said to Uthman ibn Abi al-As: You rich people have taken both this world and the Hereafter. He said: One dirham which one of you gives in charity from his hard-earned labor is better than ten thousand dirhams which one of us gives in charity from excess in abundance. Also narrated through another chain: Mutarrif ibn Abdullah came to Uthman ibn Abi al-As and asked permission. He sat at the door. Then he was allowed in. Uthman said: An hour for this world and an hour for the Hereafter, and Allah the Exalted knows which of the two will predominate over us. Mutarrif said: You have taken both this world and the Hereafter. He said: The dirham obtained by one of you from his labor, which he spends in righteous ways, is better than ten thousand dirhams which one of us obtains from excess in abundance. Also through another chain: A slave of Uthman ibn Abi al-As asked him to give him money to trade with, with profits shared between them. He gave him twenty thousand. The slave bought wine with it. Then he came with it to al-Ubulla. Uthman came out to meet him and did not leave a container without breaking it.

english_translation: Uthman ibn al-As said: I came to visit him and he offered me milk, but I said: I am fasting. He replied: I heard the Prophet say: Fasting is a shield from Hellfire like your shield protects you from battle. Good fasting is three days a month. And when the Prophet appointed me over Taif, he instructed me: O Uthman, be lenient in prayer and judge people by their weakest member, for among them are the weak, the sick, the distant, and the needy.

english_translation: Al-Hasan reported: Ziyad sent Kilab ibn Umayyah as governor over al-Ubulla. When Uthman ibn Abi al-As passed by, he said: O father of Aaron, what keeps you here? Kilab said: This man appointed me governor over al-Ubulla. Uthman said: Over the customs tax! Then he said: Shall I tell you a hadith I heard from the Prophet? I heard the Prophet say: Truly, Prophet David would wake his family in the night and say: O people of David, rise and pray! For at this hour Allah accepts supplications except from a sorcerer or tax collector. Then Uthman boarded his ship and came to Ziyad and said: Appoint over your affairs whom you wish.

english_translation: Al-Mughirah said: The Prophet ate food, and I brought water for ablution. On a previous occasion, when he had eaten and I brought water, he rebuked me saying something that grieved me. After the Prophet finished, I complained to Umar ibn al-Khattab. Umar said: O Messenger of Allah, al-Mughirah was distressed by your rebuke and feared you had something against him. The Prophet replied: I have nothing but goodness toward him.
